goals.question: What is the distribution of salaries across different job types?
goals.visualization: Box plot of salary vs job type
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the range, median, and outliers of salaries across different job types.

goals.question: What is the trend of job openings over time?
goals.visualization: Line chart of job openings vs time
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there are any seasonal trends or changes in job openings over time.

goals.question: What is the most common job title in the dataset?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of job title vs count
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify the most common job title in the dataset and understand the distribution of job titles.

goals.question: What is the distribution of required education level for different job types?
goals.visualization: Stacked bar chart of job type vs education level
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the education requirements for different job types and identify any patterns or trends.

goals.question: What is the correlation between years of experience and salary?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of years of experience vs salary
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the relationship between years of experience and salary and identify any outliers or patterns.

code:
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    sns.boxplot(x='job_type', y='salary', data=data)
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.title('What is the distribution of salaries across different job types?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    
    data['date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['date'], errors='ignore')
    data = data.sort_values(by='date')
    
    sns.lineplot(x='date', y='job_openings', data=data)
    
    plt.title('What is the trend of job openings over time?', wrap=True)
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    job_title_counts = data['job_title'].value_counts().reset_index()
    job_title_counts.columns = ['job_title', 'count']
    chart = sns.barplot(x='job_title', y='count', data=job_title_counts)
    chart.set_xticklabels(chart.get_xticklabels(), rotation=45, horizontalalignment='right')
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        chart.xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.title('What is the most common job title in the dataset?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    education_job = data.groupby(['job_type', 'education_level']).size().unstack()
    education_job.plot(kind='bar', stacked=True)
    plt.title('What is the distribution of required education level for different job types?', wrap=True)
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    sns.scatterplot(data=data, x='years_of_experience', y='salary')
    plt.title('What is the correlation between years of experience and salary?', wrap=True)
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()
